div.ab: (Lines 1–7) To [the most God-pleasing] Theodoros, son of Obodianos, archdeacon of the most holy church of . . . the Metropolis, originating from it, [but residing temporarily] in Kastron Zadakathon, [Flavius Kyrikos, son of N, . . . . . ] on behalf of the most virtuous Arista, [daughter of N, . . . ] having her domicile and temporarily residing in the most holy . . . greetings. (Lines 7–14) I agree through this my receipt that I have received [and] have been paid [by you] . . . the . . . [from the . . . ] indiction of the past [ . . . year . . . until the . . . ] t(e)enth indiction, for one sixth of the place Sarg Adi[ , every year] for one, one half, one twenty-fourth . . . iugerum, one fourth . . . . . of the said tax . . . . . (Lines 15–26) . . . of [my?] spouse from the inheritance [of the] most blessed [N, son of N,] and the other two thirds of the tax for [the same plot pertain] to the most magniﬁcent Ailianos, son of Monaxios, illustris, [and] to the most God-pleasing Ioannes, son of Ouares, . . . and to be paid . . . . . of the above-written grainland . . . my spouse, for the said twenty-ﬁve years,[and] I agree with my own personal liability and that of my property that not [me or my] said [spouse] nor her heirs or successors has any claim . . . . . of the afore-mentioned plot [ . . . up to the . . . ] t(e)enth indiction and including (it). (Lines 26–39) And I afﬁrm this [ . . . without] any treachery, with my own personal liability and that of my property and . . . . . from the eleventh [indiction . . . . . ] my spouse, of the above-mentioned . . . of the same tax to the sacred houses of the [holy and] glorious . . . and Theodoros the Martyr [in] Zadakathon, the said Kastron, . . . to my most blessed father-in-law N, from [ . . . ceded] by him to the same holy houses and . . . the heirs and successors, and free from liability [and] unharmed [and] undisturbed and . . . keep . . . and the heirs [and] successors . . . (Lines 40–48) . . . her successors, rent . . . not requesting from you the accounts for the sake of the above-written tax for the preceding [and following?] times . . . to pledge . . . . . and for [your] security [I have issued this receipt], written by the hand of Flavius Nonnos, son of Auxon, prior?, I myself [having asked] him to write [this] for me, because I write very little. [It was written] on the thirtieth [of the month X] of the year four hundred sixty- . . . and I have signed. (Lines 48–59) (2. H.) † I, Flavius Kyrikos, [son of N , the above-mentioned, . . . ] representing myself and [the most virtuous Arista, daughter of –]lios, my spouse, have issued this [present receipt] in its entirety for you, the most God-pleasing [Theodoros, son of Obodianos, . . . ] tax for one sixth of the above-written [plot . . . . . twenty-[ﬁve years. . . . . indiction(?) and including (it) and for the [time] thereafter . . . . . of one-sixth of the [same tax . . . ] and having been asked the formal question, I have agreed . . . the said [Arista . . . (Lines 59–66) (3. H.) † I, Flavius N, . . . spouse of the said [most virtuous Arista] . . . each year for one, one half, [one twenty-]fourth iugerum, that is, from the above-written [ . . . indiction, . . . . . ] having signed with my own hand. † (4. H.) . . . . . having signed with my own hand. † (5. H.) . . . . . I witness, having signed with my own hand. †
